summary: Oscar, re: Blender Artist showing their work
mainText: 'A real artist doing real work... Keep it upüôèüèª'

summary: Slikey, re: Client Side Scripts
mainText: 'We said we don't want client modding but client-local scripts are something we can absolutely support. It would hinge on a very limitted API but absolutely within the realm of possibility and doesn't violate any of our core principles to UGC.'

summary: BuddhaCat, re: Vippori saying she'll wear her iconic violet jacket, with an image
mainText: 'Yesssss üíú'

summary: Slikey continues his last tweet
mainText:
'Here is some additional documentation from Unreal Engine's most modern gameplay architecture: https://github.com/tranek/GASDocumentation?tab=readme-ov-file#concepts-p

You can see here how a data-driven system can be used to implement client prediction and make sensible limits. 

"Epic's mindset is to only predict what you "can get away with". For  example, Paragon and Fortnite do not predict damage. Most likely they  use ExecutionCalculations for their damage which cannot be predicted anyway."

We already have a range of analogue capabilities in our "Interaction" system which does partial prediction and state management. We have work to do there but talking about fundamental architecture constraints is just Dunning-Kruger.'

summary: Slikey continues his last tweet
mainText: 'You refer to client side prediction in your message but then make no effort to imagine how our asset system and the game may support it. Client modding is not required when you have a rich SDK.'

summary: Slikey, re: user saying server-side mods mean latency is major factor
mainText: 'You are confidently wrong. You are making assumptions based on inexperience. Please refer to https://gabrielgambetta.com/client-side-prediction-server-reconciliation.html to get started on client-side prediction and then try to imagine how our assets and scripts could be used to predict outcomes and enable latency compensation.'

YouTubers, Modders, Map Makers, Artists and Streamers are welcome!'

summary: Simon, re: teased video
mainText: 'Alright, everyone voted against posting the full video (including myself), so I'll post a heavily edited version and give some context.'

summary: Slikey, re: modding
mainText: 'I can't because it doesn't exist in Minecraft. This will be the biggest issue of Hytale modding: People have to leave their Minecraft modding brain at the door and accept new paradigms. There are many differences that will be confusing at first contact.'

summary: Paris, re: Big Dude/Slamma song
mainText: 'Beautiful song, thank you both for making it :)'

summary: Slikey, re: modding
mainText: 'It really shouldn't be too hard to imagine how it will all function in the vision if someone researches Unreal Engine, Roblox and Minecraft. Yes the concept for Hytale UGC is new but none of the parts are new and we are just bundling it all together into a vision that we believe is striking the balance between empowering, compatible and accessible.'

summary: Slikey, re: modding
mainText:
'As we follow the Unreal Blueprints model, you will be able to create new visual nodes with your own Java Logic and use those nodes in visual scripting easily. All of these things are solved conceptually in Unreal Engine.
The client side visual scripts will be more limited but also just focus on better client prediction and some basic UX improvements which are less critical for now.'
